caption.center: In the Matter of WILLIAM C., a Person Alleged to be a Juvenile Delinquent.

court.center: Appellate Division of the Supreme Court of New York, Fourth Department.

opinion.posture: Appeal from the Erie County Family Court, Sedita, J.
opinion.opinion_text: Order unanimously reversed on the lawPage 1005 without costs and matter remitted to Erie County Family Court for further proceedings on the petition. Memorandum: The admission to the allegations of the petition was made by the Law Guardian and not by respondent personally. Further, the court did not ascertain through allocution that respondent admitted to the acts alleged in the petition, that he voluntarily waived his rights to a fact-finding hearing, and that he was aware of the possible dispositional orders (see, Family Ct Act § 321.3). Accordingly, the court should not have accepted the admission (see, Matter ofTina P., 135 A.D.2d 1105).
opinion.panel: Present — Callahan, J.P., Denman, Boomer, Balio and Lawton, JJ.
